criteria: Accuracy of choosing the appropriate trigonometric function (sine or cosine) based on the periodic phenomenon.
Accuracy in determining and applying the amplitude of the trigonometric function to match the periodic phenomena.
Accuracy in determining and applying the frequency of the trigonometric function to match the periodic phenomena.
Accuracy in determining and applying the midline of the trigonometric function to match the periodic phenomena.
Overall correctness and completeness of the trigonometric function in modeling the periodic phenomenon.
descriptions: Does not attempt to choose a trigonometric function or chooses an inappropriate function with no justification.
Chooses a trigonometric function (sine or cosine) but with no rationale.
Chooses a trigonometric function, but the rationale is superficial or incorrect.
Chooses an appropriate trigonometric function for the phenomenon, providing a basic rationale. May have minor flaws.
Correctly chooses an appropriate trigonometric function with a clear explanation of why it fits the phenomenon.
Demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of why the chosen trigonometric function accurately models the phenomenon with a detailed explanation.
Does not attempt to determine or apply amplitude.
Attempts to determine amplitude, but it is highly inaccurate and not applied correctly.
Calculates amplitude with significant errors, leading to a poor model.
Calculates amplitude with minor errors that slightly affect the accuracy of the model.
Accurately determines and applies the amplitude, resulting in a good fit for the phenomenon.
Demonstrates a precise understanding of amplitude and its role in modeling the periodic phenomena accurately and effectively.
Does not attempt to determine or apply frequency.
Attempts to determine frequency, but it is highly inaccurate and not applied correctly.
Calculates frequency with significant errors, leading to a poor model.
Calculates frequency with minor errors that slightly affect the accuracy of the model.
Accurately determines and applies the frequency, resulting in a good fit for the phenomenon.
Demonstrates a precise understanding of frequency and its role in modeling the periodic phenomena accurately and effectively.
Does not attempt to determine or apply the midline.
Attempts to determine the midline, but it is highly inaccurate and not applied correctly.
Calculates the midline with significant errors, leading to a poor model.
Calculates the midline with minor errors that slightly affect the accuracy of the model.
Accurately determines and applies the midline, resulting in a good fit for the phenomenon.
Demonstrates a precise understanding of the midline and its role in modeling the periodic phenomena accurately and effectively.
The constructed trigonometric function bears no resemblance to the periodic phenomenon.
The constructed trigonometric function has major flaws and does not accurately model the periodic phenomenon.
The trigonometric function is incomplete or contains significant errors.
The trigonometric function models the periodic phenomenon, but with noticeable inaccuracies or omissions.
The trigonometric function accurately models the periodic phenomenon with all key components correctly represented.
The constructed trigonometric function is a precise, complete, and insightful representation of the periodic phenomenon, demonstrating a deep understanding of the concepts.
